intro: Diflugossa divaricata, commonly known as the variable diflugossa, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers with four petals. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
